Pore/Structural Features.Structure Type: Hollow tubular fibrous structure, hierarchical fibrous morphology characterized by interwoven hollow fibers, forming an interlaced three-dimensional network

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size exclusion; physical blocking by grid fence structure interlaced between fibers; non-selective repulsion

Other Information.Test Conditions: Optimal EE-SPME extraction conditions (0.5 V, 25 min, 600 rpm, pH 7, 290°C desorption); in human urine and plasma samples
Other Information.Additional Info: Effective exclusion demonstrated against specific interferers like Lys M (14 kDa) and HAS (67 kDa), significantly reducing matrix interference in biological samples.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Pore physical adsorption; adsorption affinity; electro-enhanced migration accelerated by external electric field due to complementary charges

Other Information.Test Conditions: Optimal EE-SPME extraction conditions (0.5 V, 25 min, 600 rpm, pH 7, 290°C desorption); in human urine and plasma samples
Other Information.Additional Info: Small target molecules effectively pass into the pores for adsorption and enrichment.

Sieving Mechanism: Macromolecular size exclusion based on a physical grid fence effect formed by the interwoven fibrous structure, enabling non-selective repulsion of large molecules while allowing small molecules to pass.

Experimental Validation.Method: GC-MS/MS, EE-SPME, Adsorption kinetics and isotherm models, Cyclic voltammetry (CV), UV–visible difference spectroscopy, Scanning Electron Microscopy (SEM), Fourier Transform Infrared Spectroscopy (FT-IR), X-ray Photoelectron Spectroscopy (XPS)
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Low detection limit (0.008–0.05 ng L−1), wide linear range (0.02–1000 ng L−1), good repeatability (1.0%–7.3 %); good resistance to matrix interference (2.5%–16.7 %); higher adsorption capacity (Qm = 50.94 mg g−1) for OH-PAHs; enhanced extraction performance of 1-NAP by 3.2-7.6 times compared to commercial fibers; Enrichment Factor (EF) for 9-PHE maintained good stability (751–833) in the presence of macromolecules.

Other Information.Additional Info: Covalent Organic Framework (COF) composite with polyionic liquid (bis-PC6) formed from 3,3′-Divinyl-1,1′(1,6-hexanediyl) diimidazolium dibromide (bis-C6) within the COF pores. Prepared via a flexible filament winding fabrication method; exhibits high electrical conductivity; functions as a stable macromolecular barrier; utilized in electro-enhanced solid-phase microextraction (EE-SPME) for rapid and sensitive analysis in complex biological samples (human urine and plasma).
